title: Jeremy Clarkson gives update on new farming TV show I Bought The Farm
text:
Jeremy will be working for one farm year (Picture: Getty/ Jeremy CLarkson)

Jeremy Clarkson is currently filming his new farming TV show for Amazon Prime and he’s given fans a strange update about how it’s going.

Taking to his online driving community platform DriveTribe, The Grand Tour star uploaded a picture of the back of what appears to be a truck littered with hay.

Clarkson captioned the teaser: ‘Working for a living.’

What on Earth is going on? (Picture: DriveTribe/Jeremy Clarkson)

The TV presenter has been sharing updates with millions of fans on his Instagram account, and wrote last week: ‘F**k me, farming is hard world. I’m too tired to go to the pub.’

In another post he uploaded a photo of an upturned mushroom with the caption: ‘Edible? Or deadly?’

The 59-year-old has confirmed an eight-part series called I Bought a Farm. It follows the Grand Tour presenter as he attempts to run his own 1,000 acre working farm in Oxfordshire.

The show is currently still in production though Clarkson has been teasing fans with trickles of information about how it’s all going.

It began in Autumn and will be filmed across one farming year, the series will look at city slicker Clarkson in his sometimes poor attempts at running a farm in the countryside.

He’s already having a tough time (Picture: Amazon Prime)

The self-professed ‘inept townie’ has no agricultural knowledge, but that hasn’t stopped him from launching the show anyway.

Clarkson announced the project on Twitter earlier this month, writing: ‘Everything is going wrong. I don’t know how farmers don’t all have coronaries.’

In August, Clarkson surprised farmers when he made a surprise appearance at the Shearwell Thame Summer Sheep Fair in Oxfordshire. There, he purchased his very first sheep.

Georgia Brown, director of European originals at Amazon Studios, said: ‘Jeremy is one of Britain’s finest exports and I think I speak for the entire nation when I say I can’t wait to see what will happen when he turns his usually petrol-covered hands to life on a working farm.

‘We’re excited to bring this latest UK produced Amazon Original series to Prime Video viewers around the world next year. Wishing you lots of luck Jeremy… what could possibly go wrong?’

Amazon has yet to announce when I Bought The Farm [working title] will be released in the UK.
